text: We're in a large closet.  JACK KIEFER, an athletic Americ in his late thirties wearing a headset, is wedged into a corner, staring at a television screen. The television shows a surveillance view of the living ro that lies outside the confines of the closet.  The TV ima is in black and white.  JACK shifts, trying like hell to comfortable but he's been there a while

A bare bulb shines down on the contents of a shabby hotel room.  Directly under the blub a man, GENNADY KASIMOV, si in a straight backed wooden chair in his blood-stained T- shirt.  There are a couple of THUGS and a stray HOOKER in room behind him.  A legend:

KASIMOV is sobbing.  Uncontrollably.  A MAN enters the ro ANATOLY, an imperious Russian in his forties, a Russian godfather.  The THUGS and HOOKERS are ushered out.  ANATO looks down at KASIMOV pitiously and urges him to go and s by him in a chair he picks up for him.  KASIMOV does as h bid, looking gratefully up at ANATOLY.  They speak in Rus which is subtitled.
Kasimov, Kasimov, good that you called us.
(sobbing)

I don't remember what happened!  We were at the bar, drinking, laughing -- having fun. ANATOLY gets up out of the chair and goes to a bed across room.  A WOMAN lies half under the sheets.  She's lying i unnatural position on the bed, and the sheets are smeared with blood.  She's dead.  ANATOLY lifts her eyelid.
I don't even know how I got here. I swear, Anatoly, I never touched her!  I didn't lay a finger on her. ANATOLY moves away from the WOMAN.
Kasimov.  Don't flounder.
JACK, impatient, checks his watch.
Jesus, she's been under too long.  Come  on, come on!
You're the only one who can help me.  Desperately he tugs at ANATOLY'S jacket.  But ANATOLY hit his hand away and smacks him around the head.
JACK reacts.
ANATOLY bends close to KASIMOV.
C'mon, c'mon, tell the truth...c'mon.
They'll kill me.  ANATOLY paces up the room, away from KASIMOV.
You asked for my help.  You  asked for  my help...come on...
You're right, of course.
JACK leans forward.
The name pal...give us the name.
The contact in Minsk..the contact in  Minsk..works in a travel agency.
Come on!
Come on!
His name is.....Dimitri Miediev.
Dimitri Miediev...Dimitri Miediev...
Got him.
Back on screen, ANATOLY places a hand on KASIMOV'S should as if he had just anointed him.

In the closet, JACK types the name into a computer and cr checks -- "MIEDIEV" comes up, then "posting/American  consulate/Kiev."  JACK turns and nods to a WHOREHOUSE WAITRESS in costume i the closet next to him, dressed in traditional Russian tu and virtually no bottom.  She quickly leaves.
We enter the room for the first time as the WAITRESS does She's carrying a tray with a bottle of vodka and two shot glasses.
Now, we drink.  He pours them out and hands one to KASIMOV.
To friends.
Yes, Anatoly, yes.
Cheers.  He drinks.  He blinks.  Something felt funny about that.  Dizzied, KASIMOV swoons and passes out on the floor. ANAT moves to the closet door and opens it.
ANATOLY reaches up to his face --

and tears away a mask of flesh .  He's no middle aged  Russian mobster, he's ETHAN HUNT, an American in his earl thirties.  He gestures to KASIMOV contemptuously.  JACK h ETHAN a hypodermic kit and he goes quickly back into the  room.
(in English now)

Get rid of this scum.  Immediately, there is activity, and PEOPLE everywhere.  T OTHERS come into the room and carry KASIMOV out.  ETHAN goes quickly to the body of the dead woman. He chee the pulse in her neck, shines a penlight in her eye. He  strips the adrenalin kit and jabs the long needle into th dead woman's thigh.  He checks her pulse again, checking stopwatch.  In about ten seconds, the woman's eyes open.  CLAIRE is her name, a French woman of thirty or so. She h rolls over, GROANS, and wipes some of the blood from her  mouth.
Did we get it?
We got it.  On your feet.
I want to sleep.  Can I sleep here.
Walk, just walk.  Start walking.
I'm walking.
Talking's good, walking's better.

Sleeping's better.  Meanwhile, MEN in overalls take apart the room.  The ceil lifts right off the walls, and the walls themselves start come down, revealing the "hotel room" to be an elaborate in the middle of an empty warehouse.  JACK comes into the room from the closet.  He hands CLAIR her jewelry, including a watch and a wedding ring.  ETHAN stops what he's doing, noticing.  She looks up at him  questioningly.
Are  you all right Ethan.  What's wrong with you?
If you're gonna do this again Claire,  It's not gonna be on my watch.
Oh yeah?  JACK comes into the room from the closet.  He hands CLAIR her jewelry, including a watch and a wedding ring.  ETHAN stops what he's doing, noticing.  She looks up at him,  questioningly.
Claire.
Jack.  She almost unconsciously slips the wedding ring onto her  finger.  ETHAN notices.  He turns and SHOUTS to the room large.

head_text.subj: IS THERE ANY PARTICULAR REASON WE'RE NOT

text: Just waiting for you, tubs.  He walks across the room and out the door.  CLAIRE, worri clutches her hands together, glancing down at her wedding ring.  We move in on it --

-- and come out on another wedding ring, this one on a MA finger. One of several he's drumming on an arm rest in th plush first class cabin of a commercial airliner.  He sho some money into his wallet, and as he does so we catch a  fleeting glimpse of a photograph of CLAIRE.  The pilot's voice makes an announcement.

Ladies and gentlemen, we have leveled off  at our cruising altitude of thirty-eight  thousand feet-and we should be arriving  in Prague right on schedule.  A FLIGHT ATTENDANT makes her way between the seats, passi out menus.
Would you like to watch a movie Mr Rosen?  A passenger takes one.  The ATTENDANT continues on.

Would you like to watch a movie Mr  Phelps?  The MAN with the wedding ring looks up.  JIM PHELPS is in mid-forties, good-looking, intense.  He's a tired man, an not just now, it's a profound fatigue.  He looks up at th ATTENDANT and smiles warmly.
No, I prefer the theatre.   A look crosses the FLIGHT ATTENDANT'S face; her tone beco stilted.
Would you consider the cinema of the Ukraine?

Perhaps you'd choose one for me.  The ATTENDANT turns and walks away.  PHELPS sits back, sh a cigarette out of a pack, and taps it nervously on the  armrest.  AT THE FRONT OF THE CABIN. The FLIGHT ATTENDANT opens a case loaded with video 8  cassettes of feature films.  She opens a panel in the top the case and withdraws a tape hidden back there.

The ATTENDANT returns with the tape and hands it to PHELP He takes it without a word and she moves on.  PHELPS reaches down and turns a lever on the support betw his seat and the empty one beside him. He flips up a smal movie screen and angles it toward himself, away from the  other passengers. He puts on a headset, opens a door in t armrest, and puts the tape in.  He presses play.

the image of a man comes on.  EUGENE KITTRIDGE is fortyis but seems permanently stuck in the Nixon era -- horn rimm glasses, short short haircut, rather be caught dead than  tieless.  But if he catches your eye, he will never, ever look away.  He's seated at a desk, looking into the camer
(on the tape)

Good morning, Mr. Phelps.  The man you're  about to see is Aleksander Golitsyn --  The screen winks and shows an image of GOLITSYN, a burly in his forties.  The image is herky-jerky videotape,  presumably taken from a concealed camera as GOLITSYN walk down a foreign street.

-- a former KGB Line X officer now  working the international black market  selling intelligence.  This morning, we  learned that Golitsyn has stolen one half  of a CIA NOC list, the list of our non-  official cover agents working in Eastern  Europe.  The screen shows an image of what such a list might look  like, code names and other information scrolling by on a  computer screen at high speed.

For security reasons, the NOC list is  divided into two encoded halves.  Golitsyn already has the cryptonym  portion, which contains agent code names  and targeting areas.  This portion is  useless unless combined with the second  half -- the true name list that is kept  in the CIA station in our Embassy in Prague.  The Embassy itself comes on screen, a beautiful old build at the base of the Charles Bridge, which spans the Vltava River.

We believe Golitsyn plans to steal the  true name list at an Embassy function  tomorrow night.  Your mission, should you  decide to accept it, is to obtain  photographic proof of the theft, apprehend  those involved, and return the stolen  list.  I don't have to stress the  importance of this matter, Jim.  We're  keeping it internally black. Because of   its urgency, I've already sent to Prague  a team selected from your usual group.  Still photographs come on screen, some of which we're alr seen -- JACK KIEFER, CLAIRE and ETHAN.
Ethan Hunt will of course be your point  man, as usual.  He's in Kiev; we're  getting word to him now.
PHELPS sits back in his seat, closes his eyes, and rubs h tired brow.  KITTRIDGE himself comes back on the tape.

As always, should you or any member of  your IM force be caught or killed, the  Secretary will disavow all knowledge of  your actions.  This tape will self-  destruct in five seconds.  Good luck,  Jim!  PHELPS inhales deeply --  -- the tape in the armrest starts to smolder, sending up plume of wispy smoke --  -- and PHELPS exhales, concealing the plume in a cloud of cigarette smoke.
SARAH and HANNA, a German woman in her mid-thirties enter Another legend:  PRAGUE

The IMF team's safe house is a sparsely furnished Prague  apartment with a panoramic view of the city.  The IMF team is scattered around the room. Sketches, pads overfilled ashtrays and equipment are strewn everywhere.  JACK and SARAH seated next to each other - JACK demonstra the VISCO glasses to her.  CLAIRE is seated opposite JACK the computer.  JIM and ETHAN are in the kitchen.  HANNAH  taking a roll of black-out curtain through the room.
Look to your right, then back to me.  There's a camera built right into the  bridge.  Whatever you see it sees and  transmits it back here.  Can you hear me?
Of course I can hear you.
No, in your...ear piece. You have a  lovely smile (eyes). Can you hear me  now?
Loud and clear.
What's going on?
I don't know.
Why don't you take a look?
Jack...that's spying.
That's what we do isn't it?
Jack you're so wicked.
Too wicked to have a drink later?
I think I might just take that look.  ETHAN and JIM PHELPS are in a heated conversation.
Yeah, well, Jim, fact is I've got more  than ninety days leave coming.
A hundred and sixty-seven, I think it is.  Take it all, if you want.   After this one.
I thought I'd take some now.
(quietly, to Ethan)
What the hell's made you decide to take  your leave at the worst possible time?  Claire's in a weird mood too.
Oh?  What's the problem?
I don't know, I had to go to Chicago  again.  You were in Kiev.  You tell me.
Tell you what?
When you started noticing your short term  memory loss.  What  the problem was you  and Claire had in Kiev?
What problem?
(laughs)
Ah, God, forget it.  What are we talking burnout here?
I guess.
Ethan, you  can't burn out.
Why not?
Because I can't afford it. And because  you'd burn up before you'd burn out.  CLAIRE, who is at the computer behind them, somehow seems be the reference point in the following exchange:
How was Chicago?

Wonderful.  Ran into a convention of auto  dealers at the Drake Hotel.  You hear the  one about the astronaut who comes back  from the first manned flight to Mars  after two years?  His wife's got a year  old kid.  So he says "All right.  Who was  it?  My friend Harry?"  She says no. "Oh, it was my friend Sammy."  She says it  wasn't Sammy.  "Oh, I suppose it was my  friend Lou."  "No, what's the matter,  don't you think I have any friends of my  own?!"  PHELPS laughs.  ETHAN doesn't.  The back of CLAIRE'S head in his line of sight.
Boy, you really are grim. Come here,  take a look.  He leads ETHAN to the window, which overlooks the city.
ETHAN's POV of Embassy.
ETHAN nods.

Beyond Charles Bridge there is our  Embassy.  See it?  Tomorrow night, if  anything goes wrong, this guy will steal  the names of our agents in every country  all over Eastern Europe.  Up for grabs to  the highest bidders -- third world  terrorists, arms dealers, drug lords --  any and everybody who'd love to get rid  of long term coverts like us, and some  very dear friends among them.  If they're  exposed, they'll be executed.  Come over  here.  Take a lock at this.  CLAIRE, who is working at a computer, has pulled up a  quicktime video image in a box on her screen.  In it, an edition of the McLaughlin Report, the PBS news show, is  playing.  ETHAN is distracted by it.
SENATOR WALTZER, a bearded, bespectacled man in his forti is holding forth:

I'll go you one further.  I say the CIA  and all its shadow organizations have  become irrelevant at best and  unconstitutional at worst.  It's time we  throw a little light on the whole concept  of the Pentagon's "black budget."  These  covert agency subgroups have confidential  funding, they report to no one --  who are these people ?!  We  were living in a  democracy the last time I checked.
ETHAN looks back at JIM.
You're going to use Walter?
He's our guy.
Isn't he chairing the Armed Services hearing?
Not this week. This week he's flyfishing  at the Oughterard Slough in County  Kildare, with one of our best Irish guides.
He won't be back in a hurry?
No, not in a hurry.  What do you think?  You think the plot'll work?
Sure.  If the main character does.
If you were me, Ethan, who would  you trust to make him believable?  JACK comes breezing in with a piece of bubble gum.
Sorry, am I interrupting?
Always.  JACK shows the gum to ETHAN.
Stick of gum. If you come up against a  lock you can't pick --  Half the gum is red, the other half is green.
Red light.  Green light.  Mash them  together, asta lasagna.  Don't get any on  you -- you have five seconds.  He offers the gum to ETHAN.
Are you gonna take it?  CLAIRE glances up from the computer and catches ETHAN's e PHELPS may have caught the glance, but is focused on ETHA
(relenting)
Give me the God damn gum.
Just don't chew it.
Thank you.
The American Embassy glitters beside the Vltava River.  P at the Embassy tonight.

JACK, wearing black coveralls and slightly odd-looking  eyeglasses (they're called Visco glasses), enters an elev shaft through a small door at the base of the wall.  He l up the shaft, shining a flashlight until he finds what he looking for --
a gray metal box , protruding from the wall one floor up.

PHELPS is at a table in the safe house apartment, watchin the bank of monitors HANNAH wired together earlier. The  monitors are alive now, showing various views of the insi of the Embassy, where the party is going on, and one view the elevator shaft.  PHELPS wearing an IMF headset and speaks into the mouthpi
Ethan.  Jack's inside.  Window's open by  twenty-three hundred.

Inside the Embassy, the party is a formal, tuxedoed affai that's in full swing on the second floor.  SENATOR WALTZER, the man who was on TV, walks up a grand  staircase, headed in.  An AMERICAN DIPLOMAT in a tuxedo  hurries up to him.
How do you do, Senator, I'm Rand Housman,  the Ambassador's aide.  If I could just  steer you through the reception line here
The DIPLOMAT pilots the SENATOR by one arm, guiding him t reception line at the base of the stairs to the party.

Allow me to introduce Jaroslav Reid, the  director of the National Gallery -- Petr  Brandl, the mayor of Prague --  SARAH, a very attractive young American dressed in an ele gown, steps out of the reception line and shakes hands wi
I bet you don't remember me, do you, Senator?
Of course I do.  How are you, Miss  Norman?  He leans in and kisses her on the cheek, and as he does s SARAH whispers something in his ear.

He's in pocket.  Under the archway behind me.  Her tone, her words -- we realize she's on the team.  The SENATOR pulls a pair of Visco glasses from his pocket (and if we didn't know the SENATOR was ETHAN before, this confirms it), puts them on, and looks up, over her should

head_text.subj: UNDER AN ARCHWAY NEAR THE ENTRANCE,

text: ALEKSANDER GOLITSYN, the Ukrainian, has just come in from outside.
PHELPS sees the SENATOR's point of view of GOLITSYN, thro the glasses, broadcast back to PHELPS' monitor.  He speak into his microphone.
Sarah, mark the package and go to two.
SARAH still has the SENATOR's attention.
Your advance team mentioned you'd want a  tour of the facility, so I've gone ahead  and set that up for you --
Terrific.  Let's get going.  (to the Diplomat)
Will you excuse us?   He slips an arm around SARAH and they walk off, not into party, but the other way, toward a staircase that leads  further into the Embassy.
Uh, sir?

JACK climbs up the elevator shaft, towards the gray metal box.  He just begins to remove the cover when he hears a  noise from above.  He looks up and sees the elevator abov him descending.  JACK quickly pulls himself flush against the wall. The  elevator comes down adjacent to him and stops, pinning hi to the wall.
Great.  Come on.

As the SENATOR and SARAH pass behind the entering GOLITSY SARAH pulls a small bottle of perfume from her purse.  Bu she sprays, she points it slightly to the left, missing  herself and hitting the back of GOLITSYN'S head.  He neve notices.  They move on and down the flight of stairs.
JIM PHELPS monitors the Visco views of the party.  He loo to the fourth monitor and checks a view of the party, a j one, as someone hurrying up stairs.
Hannah.  He's marked.  Lets go.
On a flight of stairs, HANNAH, dressed for the party and  slightly out of breath, hurries up the stairs.
En route.  She also has a pair of Visco glasses, which she trains on party below.  She pushes a micro switch on the side of he glasses, activating an electronic filter, which tints the lenses.

Hannah, pull the shade (or - Hannah go to night vision).  HANNAHiS VISCO POV  the party looks the same, but one head in the crowd stand out.  That head is GOLITSYN'S, his hair a fluorescent gre where SARAH sprayed it.

The SENATOR (let's just call him ETHAN) and SARAH come do the stairs and pass a sign that says "Denied Area --  Political Attaches Only."  ETHAN checks his watch.  23:00 He nods to SARAH, they round a corner, and come to an  elevator at the end of the corridor.  A sign in front of says "Out of Order."  They head for it anyway.  A MARINE GUARD appears from behind a side door, catching by surprise.
Governor's in position.  We have the elevator.
Excuse me, can I help you?
-- which leads directly to the Denied  Area, the only limited access area in the  whole facility.  SARAH flashes an ID at the GUARD and keeps talking.

As you can see. this area has both a  Marine guard and video surveillance, and  is strictly monitored at all times.  She walks up to the thumbprint analyzer on the elevator b and slides her thumb inside.  The panel lights up and fla a message -- "ACCESS DENIED."  SARAH and ETHAN trade a lo
(covering)
Senator, don't you have a young man on  your staff named
She tries the thumb again, Still no soap.

Jack ?  I believe we did have a young man  named  Jack .  Not a reliable man, as I  recall.  Constantly late or behind in his  work.  Now the GUARD, noticing that Sarah's not being allowed  access, comes closer to them.
Excuse me, let me see that ID again!
JACK is still pinned to the wall by the elevator, listeni to their conversation.
Jack's pinned down Sarah.  Should be a  second.  Keep dancing.
(with the Senator's southern accent)
We were forced to tie him to my best  stallion and drag him around the barn a  few times.   Finally, the elevator moves down a floor and JACK is free

Relax your crack, Foghorn, I'm workin' on it.  He quickly opens the gray metal box, revealing a maze of  circuitry.  He patches in his computer, climbs on top of elevator, and hits the keyboard, beginning to download.
there's a split-screen of SARAH's thumbprint and the ID  picture.  JACK downloads her file into the security compu
Ignoring the GUARD, SARAH turns and slides her thumb into thumbprint analyzer once more.  The panel glows, this tim the message flashes --
-- and the elevator doors slide open briskly.   The GUARD, surprised, now catches sight of the SENATOR.
Oh. Sorry, sir.  He snaps a salute.  ETHAN and SARAH get into the elevator the doors close behind them.
JACK looks down at the elevator below.  Through a grating can see them inside.
The drink (date) with Sarah is definitely off.
PHELPS moves from JACK's view of the elevator car to HANN view of the party on his video monitors.
(a touch of impatience)
Hannah -- I'm blind again.  Hannah.
HANNAH, stationed on the second floor of the Embassy, mov to get a better view of the party. She reacquires GOLITSY glowing head.
He's heading to the denied area.

This work room is filled with combination lock filing  cabinets and various computer terminals.  ETHAN hands SAR his Visco glasses and she crosses the room, placing them  upside down on top of a filing cabinet.   ETHAN straps on a Visco wrist monitor and tunes it in,  switching several times.
(to Sarah)
Higher.  Higher.
Higher.
Right, right.  Good.  SARAH adjusts the glasses.
the view of the main computer terminal is upside down, bu clear.  Anyone sitting there will be recorded.
On PHELPS' monitor, we see ETHAN, via his Visco glasses o the filing cabinet, standing next to the computer.  PHELP barks out a warning.
Get moving, Ethan.  He's rolling to you.
ETHAN pushes the elevator button but the elevator is alre moving up.
Jack we're in position.
In a split view, we see both sides of the elevator wall  simultaneously -- on one side, JACK is lying on top of th rising elevator, on the other side, ETHAN and SARAH are  waiting for it to arrive.
Jack.  Jack.
I didn't touch it.  The elevator stops, the doors open --  -- and GOLITSYN gets on.  GOLITSYN descends in the elevat with JACK on top and ETHAN and SARAH waiting down below!
PHELPS sees JACK's point of view of the elevator, with  GOLITSYN inside.
(tension rising)
He's in the box, Ethan, he's in the box!
ETHAN and SARAH are waiting in front of the elevator, the GOLITSYN is about to step off of!  ETHAN looks around, fo place to hide.
OK.  Taking Golitsyn's exit.  Jack, open the doors.
What about my coat?  I'll freeze.
I don't have it.
PHELPS whips over to a laptop and starts typing.
Opening the doors.  Go under.  He jabs ENTER on his keyboard.
The elevator doors WHISK open, revealing the empty shaft  beyond.  ETHAN and SARAH jump into the shaft.

ETHAN and SARAH jump down into the five foot empty space  below the work room floor.  Above them, the elevator  continues its descent, with them hiding below.  The eleva drops to just over their heads and stops.

GOLITSYN steps off the elevator, crosses the room and sli a 3.5 computer disk into the computer in the work room.  Through the Visco glasses, we can clearly see him at work downloading the vital information.
Waiting below the elevator, ETHAN takes off his jacket,  starting to reverse it.  He checks his Visco wrist monito GOLITSYN perpetrates the theft.  He smiles and speaks int microphone.
He's got it.  Saved your ass again Jack.
Give me a break, Pops.
Such a nice ass.
And a lonely ass.
Sarah's reconsidering.  Claire, transport  in five minutes.
Roger that.
Back inside, ETHAN strips off his mask and wearing his no reversed jacket, he and SARAH exit the small door at the of the elevator shaft.
JACK rapidly disconnects his equipment.  But as he pulls final electrical clip from the elevator's wiring, it flas and SPARKS.
ETHAN and SARAH exit an Embassy service area by the  waterfront and blend into the Embassy crowd, as an amorou couple.
In position.  Jack open the door, let the package roll.
Roger that.  Opening doors now.
Stairway, youire wrapped, go to transport. ETHANiS voice comes over HANNAHiS earpiece.
En route. HANNAH breaks off and goes up the stairs.
The button marked "ROOF" lights up, seemingly all by itse
The car engages with a sharp jolt --
Hey. --and starts to rise.  JACK looks down, into the elevator car, through the grate.  Thereis no one in it.
On one of his monitors, PHELPS sees the elevator moving i the shaft.
Jack, what are you doing?!
Iim not doing anything!  (I donit have it either).
PHELPS is typing at his keyboard and jamming the enter bu but gets no response.
I donit have it --  I donit have control
JACKiS face pales.  He looks up, above him, at the approaching ceiling.
Uh -- then I have a problem.
GOLITSYN pulls out the now-programmed disk from the compu slips it in his jacket pocket and heads for the door.
JACK looks up through his Visco glasses at the approachin roof, covered with spikes.
Through the monitor, ETHAN sees JACKiS P.O.V. of the roof the building approaching.  Fast.
Cut the power.  Cut the power Jack.  Do you hear me.

On top of the elevator, JACK has ripped open the control panel again and is frantically trying to adjust wires to the thing to stop. He swears, his fingers fumble, he works faster and faster He looks up.  The roof of the building is nearly upon him
Come on, Jack, come on. JACK looks up again, he cringes, he covers his head with hands, he SCREAMS --
and heis crushed to death against the roof .
ETHAN is staring at the static on the monitor that once w JACKiS signal.
Jack.  Jack. He closes his eyes, knowing what that means.
PHELPS also sees the static.
Man down.  Stay where you are.  Iim on my way. He gets up and races out of the apartment.

who now has the disk , jabs again and again at the elevator button but it wonit even light up.  He studies t elevator doors and jumps into the shaft, just as ETHAN an SARAH did moments before. He hits the floor of the elevator shaft and exits the sma door at the shaftis base.
PHELPS hurries towards the bridge.
En route.
PHELPS dashes onto the Charles Bridge and heads across th river, toward the Embassy.  He throws a look back, over h shoulder.  Paranoiais setting in.

Outside the Embassy, GOLITSYN escapes, pushing through th service area door and racing past a DRUNKEN COUPLE who ar the midst of a loveris quarrel, in Russian. Pan past the embankment and onto the bridge where PHELPS still racing to meet ETHAN.  But he stops suddenly, as if hearing something and looks behind him, at the deepening gloom.
ETHAN and SARAH hear PHELPiS voice over the monitor.
The package is in the open.
Jim.  Jim.  Heis in the open.
Iive got a shadow.
Can you lose him?
No.  Abort. Over ETHANis shoulder, SARAH sees GOLITSYN getting away. starts to roll over the river towards the bridge.
Ethan.  Heis out of pocket.
(to Phelps)
Jim we canit.
Abort.  Thatis an order.
Negative , Golitsynis on the move.
Seated in the getaway car, CLAIRE listens to JIM and ETHA argue.
No, damn it, no, I said ABORT!
Outside the Embassy, SARAH and ETHAN argue.
Sarah eye on the package.  Jim, Iim coming to you.
Jim gave an abort, we should walk away.
No, weire going to recover the disk, understand?!  Now move! ETHAN takes off for the bridge, leaving SARAH to shadow GOLITSYN.
HANNAH hurries toward the getaway vehicle.
ETHAN moves to the bridge stairs.
Where are you?
About two hundred yards from the bridge.

Theyire covering this frequency, Ethan. Cut all radio communications.  Repeat. Cut all radio communications.   ETHAN continues to run toward the stairs to the bridge. CLAIRE who sits in the getaway car.  He looks on his moni and again sees PHELPSi POV.  Only ominous silence.  Phelp looking back over his shoulder.  The bridge is deserted.
SARAH follows GOLITSYN as he hurries toward the shore, wh a cobblestone promenade runs along the river.  He disappe into the fog at the edge of the river.
ETHAN checks his monitor again.

PHELPSi point of view changes radically as his head swive on the darkened bridge.  He whirls again, looking over hi shoulder and this time  the barrel of a gun is visible, pointing at him and before PHELPS has a chance to react a GUNSHOT CRACKLES over the monitor. The point of view goes crazy for a moment, then over and to a bloody hole in his own chest. His head rocks again, then goes over the side of the brid and makes the long, hard fall into the river below.
ETHANis face goes white with shock.

He races up the rest of the stairs to the bridge but ther no sign of PHELPS. ETHAN runs to the railing and looks down into the river b sees only dark, choppy waters below, now becoming obscured in the gathering fog. He turns and looks to the embankment.  He can faintly see GOLITSYN, hurrying along the promenade.  ETHAN gives chas
ETHAN runs towards the getaway car, reaching a vantage po on the top of the stairs, he can see CLAIREiS outline, visible in the driveris seat.  But as he descends the sta
the car explodes and bursts into flames . The force of the blast knocks ETHAN back.
He watches the burning car in stunned silence for a momen stunned CROWD starts to gather. Remembering SARAH, he rushes down the stairs towards the embankment.

SARAH comes out of the fog near the riverbank and sees GOLITSYN again, slowing down.  A MAN comes out of the fog seems to ask GOLITSYN for a light. SARAH draws closer.  Behind her, the DRUNKEN COUPLE seems be hanging with her for some reason.
ETHAN continues towards the embankment.
SARAH is almost to GOLITSYN.  Suddenly, the MAN in front

pulls him towards him .  Sensing something wrong, SARAH quickens her pace.  The MAN is now hunched over GOLITSYN, facing away from SARAH, going through GOLITSYNi pockets. The figure finds what itis looking for -- the disk -- and takes it.  SARAH comes closer -- -- and the figure whirls.  It brings a knife up sharply, plunges it into her chest and slinks away out of sight.

ETHAN races around the corner onto the embankment.  He bu out of the fog, just in time to see SARAH fall to her kne over GOLITSYNis body.  ETHAN sees the knife in her chest GASPS. He pulls the knife out of SARAH, who is close to death. looks at it -- it is a black Teflon knife with a serrated edge.
The DRUNKEN COUPLE seem drunk no more.  In fact, theyire watching ETHAN.  Through the fog and night, they see him leaning over SARAH, holding the knife in his hands.
SARAH goes still.  ETHAN lays her down, turns the other b over and sees that it is GOLITSYN.  He quickly begins rummaging through his pockets. ETHAN hear police sirens and sees...

A Prague police boat, SIREN wailing, arrives at the dock front of the Embassy.  The DRUNKEN MAN and WOMAN stop suddenly. As THREE POLICE leap off the boat and race toward the explosion, ETHAN leaps over the gate and races up the all and out of sight.

ETHAN unscrews the mouthpiece of a payphone receiver.  He holding a flat piece of metal with six prongs on it, a  modernist cockroach.  He CLICKS the cockroach into the gu of the phoneis wiring, piercing it with its little prongs He screws the mouthpiece back on, holds the phoneis tongu down for a second, releases it and listens.  He has a dia tone.  Now he punches in a fourteen digit number he knows heart. After a moment, a FLAT VOICE comes on the other side.
Satcom seven.
Central Europe.  Unsecured.
Designator?
Bravo Echo one one.
Switching. There is a long pause and then familiar voice comes on th line.
This is Kittridge.
Go secure. Pause.  A funny series of CLICKS comes over the line.
Go ahead.
Theyire dead.
Whois dead?
My team.  Claire, Jack, even Jim - - Hannah, maybe, I -- donit know
Are you damaged?
They knew we were coming.  Golitsynis dead too.  The disk is gone.
Are you intact
Do you read me?   The list is in the open
Let's just bring you in safely, and then we'll worry about that, okay?  Were you followed? ETHAN closes his eyes.  KITTRIDGEiS voice is strong and reassuring and he needs that right now.
I donit think so.
Donit  think , be  sure .  Are you clean?
Yes.
Location green.  One hour.  Iill be there myself.
Youire in Prague?
Heard a lot about you, Hunt.  Donit disappoint me.
No sir.
One hour. He hangs up.  ETHAN does the same.  He stares at the phon for a moment, thinking.  He checks his watch.

ETHAN steps out of the phone booth and starts down the street.  Every face seems to be starring at him now, ever sound is menacing.  He pulls his coat in tight, shoves hi hands in his pockets and walks among the crowd.

ETHAN makes his way past the old town clock, a towering, gothic structure and into a plaza, surrounded mostly by  residential buildings. ETHANiS POV Straight across from him is a glass enclosed restaurant b on the portico of an old palace. Brilliantly lit up from inside, the restaurant positively shimmers, every table visible from everywhere in the plaz

ETHAN walks in the glass front doors, right next to an  enormous fish tank, part of the restaurant's exterior wal He scans the clientele carefully -- maybe a dozen PATRONS scattered around.  EUGENE KITTRIDGE is seated at a table in the middle. He a ETHAN make eye contact.  ETHAN walks to the table, a coup of quick, seemingly cursory glances around the room as he goes.  KITTRIDGE has been working on a pretty good-sized  lobster.  He rises to greet ETHAN and they sit.
I can't tell you how sorry I am.  I know  how much Jim in particular meant to you,  Ethan.  Personally as well as professionally.
Yeah.  He spots a stack of documents on the table. ETHAN picks them up.  There's a Canadian picture bearing  ETHAN photo and the name Phillipe Doucette, credit cards, driver's license, etc.
Passport, visas - you know the drill.  We'll work the exfiltration thru Canada,  debrief you at Langley.  Throw the Prague  police a bone, you know toss them a few  suspects.  Follow me?
Yeah.  I follow you.
We've lost enough agents for one night.
You mean  I've lost enough agents for one  night.  KITTRIDGE seems to be at the point of saying one thing, t carefully:
You seem hell bent on blaming yourself,  Ethan.
Who else is left?
Yes.  I see your point.
Why was there another team?
What?
Of IMF agents.  At the Embassy.  Tonight.
I don't quite follow you.
Let's see if you can follow me around  this room.  (eyes moving around the room)

The drunk Russians on the embankment at 7  and 8 o'clock...The couple waltzing  around me at the Embassy at 9 and 11.  The waiter behind Hannah at the top of  the staircase - Bowtie, 12 o'clock. The  other IMF team.  You're worried about me.  Why
(a tight little smile)
You're right.  Maybe this'll save some  time.  The figures around the room have grown restless.  KITTRID tries to indicate that it's okay. He pulls some papers ou of his jacket.
For a little over two years now we've  been spotting serious blowback in IMF  operations.  We have a penetration.  The  other day we decoded a message on the  Internet from a Czech we know as "Max."
The arms dealer.

That's right.  Max, it seems, has two  unique gifts -- a capacity for anonymity and for corrupting susceptible agents.  This time he's gotten to someone on the  inside - he's put himself in a position  to buy our NOC list. An operation he  referred to as "Job 314".  The job he  thought Golitsyn was doing tonight.
But the list Golitsyn stole was a decoy.
Correct the actual list is safe at  Langley.  "Golitsyn" was a lightning rod,  one of ours.
This whole operation was a molehunt.
Yes, the mole's deep inside. And -- like  you said.  You survived.  ETHAN stares at him levelly.

I want to show you something, Ethan.  He now shoves the papers across the table.  They're xerox copies of a Wisconsin bank account in the name of DONALD MARGARET ETHAN HUNT.  It shows a balance of $127, 000.

Since your father's death, your family's  farm has been in sub-chapter S and now,  suddenly, they're flush with over a  hundred and twenty grand in the bank.  Dad's illness was supposed to have wiped  out the bank account -- dying slowly in  America after all, can be a very  expensive proposition Ethan.  So, why  don't we go quietly out of here onto the  plane...
How about if we just go quietly into the  bathroom and I wash your mouth out with  soap - you pathetic button down  bureaucratic asshole.
Ethan, I can understand you're very  upset.
Kitteridge, you've never seen me very  upset.  ETHAN takes something from his jacket pocket.  While  KITTRIDGE talks, ETHAN unwraps whatever is in his hand.

All right, enough is  enough Hunt. You've  bribed, cajoled, killed - and relied on  intimate loyalties to get away with it.  You're determined to shake hands with the  devil and I'm going to make sure you do  it in hell.  We see what ETHAN holds in his hand -- it's the piece of  bubble gum, half red, half green. He squeezes the gum,  mushing the two sides together.  ETHAN lashes out, swatting KITTRIDGE'S glass of wine off table in one quick motion.  As he does, he hurls the piec gum.  Diners look up, startled at the sound of the breaking win glass.  KITTRIDGE follows the trajectory of the glass --  -- and sees the piece of gum, stuck to the tank. His eyes widen.  KA BOOM!  The tiny piece of plastique explodes, SHATTERING the fish tank.  A hundred gallons of water flow over the MAN and  WOMAN, knocking them to the ground.  At the same time, ETHAN bolts for the door.
ETHAN races out of the restaurant and takes off, into the deserted square.
Silence.  ETHAN enters the darkened entry.
ETHAN glances up at the stairwell.  Naked light bulbs  illuminate the way up.  He slips off his jacket and shirt then puts his jacket back on.
ETHAN unscrews a bulb.  He crushes the bulb in his shirt scatters the glass fragments on the steps.  He climbs to next bulb.
At the now-darkened door to the apartment, there's the so sound of another bulb being POPPED in cloth, glass fragme dropping and ETHAN'S at the door.
In the darkened safe house, ETHAN goes to a vase with  flowers, picks it up and unscrews the bottom, retrieving Sig Sauer automatic. He moves through the rooms, checking them as he goes.

ETHAN checks the shower, then goes to his shaving kit,  pulling out a shaving cream can and a hairspray can.  He  unscrews the bottoms, retrieving cash in various  denominations from various countries and a couple of  passports.  As he pockets them, he catches sight of himself in the mirror.  He's a mess.  He splashes water on his face.
ETHAN greedily tears the cap off a bottle of mineral wate and proceeds to guzzle it as if he was dying of thirst.
He comes back into the living room. Still drinking, he  notices flickering lights on the other side of the room, static from the four monitors PHELPS was watching.  One b one, he switches them off.
JACK had been using lies closed at his abandoned desk.  E wakes it up.  The computer emits a DIAL TONE, then STATIC as it hits it connection.  It prompts ETHAN along:
job 314
Job.  Job 3:14.  March fourteen.  Job 31  March.  The computer replies:
ETHAN tries again:  max.com The answer:

He tries a few more, quickly -- "job," "jobs," "joblist.c but nothing comes up.  He tries something else -- "scroll usenet groups."   The computer scrolls names of bulletin boards at a dizzyi speed, by the hundreds.  That's not going anywhere.  ETHAN pauses, slaking his bottomless thirst and trying to figure out what permutation of "job 314" he should add to others on his computer screen.  He MUMBLES.
Job three fourteen.  Job -- (a realization,  the Biblical pronunciation)
It's  Job

He rummages around on the desk, checks the bookshelf and  finds a Gideon Bible.  He turns to Job 3:14 and reads the Bible passage "Kings and Counsellors..."  He thinks for another moment, then punches back into the  Internet and under the command "Select Usenet Group" he  types:
The computer replies:
The computer presents a multi-colored screen of religious icons and artwork with an accompanying message:

head_text.subj: WELCOME TO THE BOOK OF JOB DISCUSSION
GROUP. WHICH CHAPTER AND VERSE DO
YOU WISH TO POST YOUR ENTRY UNDER

text: ETHAN types his answer "Job 3:14" and the screen presents "stickie" for him to write his message on.  He does:
Max -- Goods tainted.  Consider extremely  hazardous.  DO NOT USE.  Fate will be  that of kings and counsellors who built  for themselves palaces now lying in  ruins.  Must meet to discuss a.s.a.p.

A rhythmic CRUNCHING sound and from the darkness on the o side of the room, PHELPS staggers toward him, wet and mud his middle a hopelessly bloody mess.  He looks like he's  dying on his feet.  ETHAN freezes, appalled.
Ethan, what are you doing?  ETHAN tries to speak but nothing will come out.

I needed you, Ethan. 1 needed you on the  bridge, and -- you weren't there.  Ethan?  Ethan?  ETHAN reaches out to grab PHELPS but can't seem to touch PHELPS suddenly vanishes into thin air, ETHAN awakens fro the dream and finds himself leaping to his feet, gun cock and pointed at --
It's
What are you doing here?!  CLAIRE freezes, her hands half-raised.
(carefully)
Ethan -- Ethan, it's okay.  It's Claire.  Ethan what's wrong with you?
Don't move.  Her right hand has moved a fraction.  She freezes again.
You were in the car!
I wasn't.  I heard that Jim was in  trouble on the radio.  He said someone  was...
Shut up!  I saw you.  You were in the  car.
No, I got out of the car and I ran to the bridge.
Don't give me that!  I was on the bridge.
What happened to Jim?
There was nobody on the bridge.
What happened to Jim?  Ethan grabs her wrists, shouting.
Dead.  Dead.  Dead!  Wake up, Claire!  Jim's dead, they're dead.  They're all  dead!  ETHAN releases her wrists.
(mumbling)
They're dead.  Jim's dead.
Take off your coat.
What?

Take off your God damn coat!  He grabs a sleeve and literally tears the coat off her, h spinning her around.  The coat hits the floor like a dead body.  CLAIRE'S instinctive move is to cover her chest.  CLAIRE begins to shiver.  ETHAN circles her, runs his han cursorily across her body.  It accentuates CLAIRE'S  shivering.
Where were you?
I walked away.  He said abort.  He was  gone so I walked away.
That was four hours ago!  Who sent you?  Did they send you here?
(slowly)
Who is "they?"
Did they send you...Did they send you?
Who is they, who is they?  ETHAN grabs her by the wrists.
Who sent you?!  Who sent you?
(screaming)

No one sent me!  We're supposed to be  back here at four o'clock, four o'clock,  if we abort, we don't return here until  four o'clock, 0-four hundred, four am,  four o'clock --!  She sags.  A moment.  Then the clock begins to chime -- B BONG, BONG, BONG.  In the wake of the bells' reverb, ETHA releases his grip on her wrists.
ETHAN sits in front of the computer, staring blankly at i still waiting for a response.  CLAIRE sitting on the end the bed.  Dawn approaches, it's very, very quiet.
Why haven't they brought us in yet?

I've been disavowed.  They think I killed  Jim and everyone else.  Somehow a hundred  thousand dollars found its way into my  parents' bank account.  Kittridge assumes  I'm a mole they've been tracing and I've  been in the employ of an arms dealer,  Max, for the last two years, to get him  our NOC list.  A long moment while she stares at ETHAN's back.
What are you going to do?
I'm going to get it for him.  Whoever the  mole is, I think goes by the name of Job,  at least part of the time. 1 can't find  him, but if he knows 1 have the NOC list,  he'll find me.
Ethan, you're not making sense. Let me  go in and talk to Kittridge. I'm going  to tell him you had nothing to do...
Claire, Claire, Claire, if you're not  dead, he's going to assume you're with  me.  The computer blinks and makes a noise - ETHAN goes to it.
Blinking -- "MESSAGE WAITING."  ETHAN hurries over and cl on the message box.  The screen blinks and the message sh up:  ?        JOB - CORNER OF NEKAZANKA AND PRlKOPY ONE P.M.
CLAIRE looks to ETHAN.
The message is for Job.
I'm going to answer it.
ETHAN arrives at the bus stop outside the Savoy Arcade. A MAN in a black wind-breaker sits on the bench, his back t

Excuse me, could I trouble you for a  match?  Without turning, the MAN offers up a box of matches. As  ETHAN takes them, TWO MEN from behind take him by either and escort him into a car which has just pulled up.
ETHAN slides into the back seat, between the TWO MEN.  MATTHIAS, the man on the left, holds up a black hood.  He extends it to ETHAN, who doesn't take it.
Would you remove your hat please?
Why?
You wish to meet Max?  This is the price  of admission.  Reluctantly, Ethan pulls the hood over his head and the c takes off.

The black hood still on his head, ETHAN has trouble sitti upright.  He's before a desk, in an apartment somewhere i the city -- it's impossible to tell where, as the blinds drawn.  The place is roomy and lavishly furnished --  expensive Oriental rugs, well-chosen objects of art.  Somewhere down the block, a dog BARKS, steadily, every fe seconds. In the hallway outside the apartment door, someo is VACUUMING.  MATTHIAS and the OTHER MAN are nearby.
I thought I was going to see Max.
You misunderstood.  No one sees Max.
Then what am I doing here?
Allowing Max to see you and hear what  you've got to say.
I don't communicate very well through a  shroud.
If Max doesn't like what you have to say,  you'll be wearing that shroud  indefinitely.
I'm willing to take the chance.
Very well.  MAX'S figure into frame.  MATTHIAS removes ETHAN's hood.  When it comes off ETHAN finds himself looking up at a tal woman of indeterminate age.  She's handsome to the point severity.
Who are you and what are you doing here?
I need one hundred thousand dollars.
Really?  And you thought if you simply  showed up I might give it to you?
Why not?  You gave Job a hundred and  twenty five thousand.

The penny drops.   You are  not Job.  Yes,  Job is not given to quoting Scripture in  his communications. And there was its  tone -- aggressive but playful.  Job is  not playful.  So you're something of a  paradox.
That depends.
On what?
Whether you like a paradox.  I want a  hundred and fifty thousand dollars.
It's quite out of the question.
The disk Job sold you is worthless.  It's  bait, part of an internal molehunt.
And how might you know that?  Are you  another Company man?
Like Job?
Ah, but, we're asking about you.
I'm NOC.  Was.   Now disavowed.
Why, may I ask?
That's the question I want to ask Job.
I don't know Job any more than he knows  me.
Even so, I'm sure you could arrange an  introduction.
Why should I?
Because I can deliver the actual NOC  list.  The one you have is not only  worthless, it's certain to be equipped  with a homing device to pinpoint your  exact location.
It's easy to say the disk is worthless  when you say I can't look at the  information and  see if it's worthless.  Not a tenable position, sir.
Okay, boot it up and in anywhere from  thirty seconds to ten minutes you're  gonna have Virginia farm boys hopping  around you like jackrabbits.
(Pause.)
Mm - Hmmm...
Tell you what.  How good's the RF scanner  you used in the car?
Very good.
Okay, use it.  But I suggest pack up  first.

MATTHIAS boots up.  There's a little musical noise and th screen brightens.  The computer WHIRS and CLICKS and a  complex list of names, addresses, phone numbers and other personal information scrolls by.  But Matthias is watchin the digital read-out on the RF scanner.
Twenty-six, twenty-seven.  So far so  good.
That's not so good for you, my friend.  On the scanner, the digital read-out is now in the thirti
Thirty-two and change.
(to Ethan)
Doesn't mean it's a signal.  Could just  be the hard drive heating up.  She looks from the scanner to ETHAN as if she's trying to make up her mind about something.
Forty-four.  Forty-five.
I'd say you've got about two minutes.  MAX still doubts it. The OTHER MAN goes to the windows -- --nothing happens. He opens the French doors that lead ou onto a balcony.

The OTHER MAN comes out on the balcony.  Nothing out here a beautiful day.  He walks to the railing and looks down the street.  Down below, the dog that's still barking is tied to a str sign.  WOOF.  WOOF.  WOOF.  Abruptly, it stops.
Back inside:
Fifty-seven. Fifty-nine.
A pollution control van and a taxi arrive amidst other st activity. KITTRIDGE and the FEMALE CZECH AGENT exit the t as BARNES and TWO OTHER UNDERCOVER MALE IMF agents leave van.
Led by KITTRIDGE, the FIVE IMF AGENTS wearing Kevlar-line trenchcoats creep through the lobby of the building and h the stairs. They climb them silently.
A CLEANING WOMAN is vacuuming the hall carpeting when the AGENTS come up the stairs, guns drawn. Her jaw drops and turns off the vacuum cleaner.
(in czech)
Switch it on.  Keep cleaning.  KITTRIDGE looks at her sharply and gestures.  She turns t vacuum back on. They reach the door of a certain apartmen and --

-- KICK through it.  The AGENTS swarm into MAX'S apartmen guns waving in all directions.  KITTRIDGE sweeps in betwe them and takes command of the place --  --but there's nobody here.  TWO AGENTS race into the bedr and just as quickly out again.
MAX, ETHAN, MATTHIAS and the OTHER MAN move quickly acros the bridge that connects Max's apartment to the tower.
KITTRIDGE kicks open the door to the balcony, comes outsi and looks around.  Nobody in sight.
Oh dear, Gunther will never let me use  one of his apartments again.  (turns to Ethan)
Phew, sorry I doubted you, dear boy.  You're a good sport.  Do accept the  compliment.
Thanks, Max.  Or is it Maxine?
I don't have to tell you what a comfort  anonymity can be in my profession -- like  a warm blanket.  (abruptly)
My deal with Job was subject to a  successful boot scan.  Obviously it  didn't pass muster.  Deal's off.
What was your deal with Job?

Six million dollars.  I'll give you the  same.  But I want the complete list now,  not just Eastern Europe.  I won't do this  piecemeal, it's too dangerous.  I want  the  entire list, the true name of every  non-official cover agent throughout the  world.
Ten million.  Ten million in negotiable  U.S. Treasury certificates, in bearer  form, coupons attached.  And one more  thing -- your personal assurance that Job  will be at the exchange.
Done.  Bring it to me in London.  I want  it by the end of the week.
How will you make sure Job will be there?
How will you make sure I'll have the list  in three days?  It's been a delight.  Now  where can I drop you dear boy?
I'm not being dropped anywhere without my  money.  MAX manages to laugh without coughing.  Then, with an  admonishing forefinger:
I'm going to have to front you  personally.  Don't lose that money  without losing your life.
I wouldn't dream of it.  MAX settles back and regards ETHAN.  A theatrical sigh. fancies this guy.
KITTRIDGE waits on the balcony for his AGENTS to complete their search.  HARRY BARNES, a middle-aged, gray suited,  somewhat gray-faced bureaucrat, comes to join Kittridge.
The man's gone black, Barnes.  He's under  until he decides to surface.
Look we can use someone from the Embassy  and we can get the local authorities  involved. Close off his transportation.

What can we do, Barnes?  Put a guy at the  airport?  How many identities do you  think Hunt has?  How many times has he  slipped past custom, in how many  countries?  These guys are trained to be  ghosts.   We taught them how to do it, for  Christ's sake!
So what do you suggest?
Let's not waste time chasing him.  Make  him come to us.  Everybodyis got pressure  points.  Find out something that's  important to him personally and you  squeeze.
ETHAN enters the living room.  CLAIRE walks out of the  bedroom holding a gun.  ETHAN reaches into his jacket and holds up a hefty wad of currency.
Max made a deal with you?
I deliver the NOC list, Max delivers Job.

We've got seventy-five rounds for your  Glock 9, but only twenty for the Sig  Sauer, one pair of Visco glasses with  monitor, plenty of passports. You said  it yourself -- if I'm not dead, I'm with  you.
You're sure about this?
Jim was my husband. I want to know who  killed him. ( ALT ) I want to get the son  of a bitch who did this.
We need help, and we don't have time.  They have to be local.
What kind of help?

The KY57 crypto phone, a black box with an ordinary phone receiver in the top, THUNKS down on the table.  ETHAN plugs the phone cable from his laptop into the back The green display on top of the KY57 dials a number and m a computer connection.  On the computer, the screen says:
ETHAN types a password and the screen asks him for the
He types in a single word.

The word "disavowed" dissolves slowly over the stateroom high speed train, where the newly assembled IM force has  gathered around a table -- KRIEGER, a dangerous-looking  Frenchman of forty or so, LUTHER STICKELL, a muscular, so spoken American in his mid-thirties.  ETHAN, and CLAIRE.  LUTHER regards the others warily.
Simple game.  Four players.  (points to Krieger)
Exfil opens the pocket --  (and to Luther)
-- cyber ops lifts the wallet.
Bank?
IMF mainframe.
(after a moment)
Where exactly is it?
In Langley.
In Langley?  The one in Virginia, Langley?
Inside CIA headquarters at Langley.  ETHAN nods.  KRIEGER turns to CLAIRE.
Is he serious?
Always.

If we're going to Virginia, why don't we  drop by Fort Knox?  I can fly a  helicopter right in through the lobby and   set it down inside the vault and it will  be a hell of a lot easier than breaking  into the God damn CIA.
What are we downloading?
Information.
What kind?
Profitable.
Payment on delivery.
I don't know.  This I don't know.
This doesn't sound like the Luther  Stickell I've heard of.  What'd they used  to call you?  The Net Ranger?  Phineas  Phreak?  The only man alive who actually  hacked NATO Ghostcom.
There was never any physical evidence  that I had anything to do with that..  that..  (correcting himself)
With that exceptional piece of work.
You don't know what you're missing. This  is the Mt. Everest of hacks.
You're all kidding yourselves. Even with  top of the line crypto.  Cray access.  STU 3's --
Krieger can get it.  (to Krieger)
Right?
May take a little time.
May take a little time. That's not what  Claire tells me about you.
Thinking Machine laptops, I'm talking  about the 686 prototypes --  with the  artificial intelligence Risk chip --  ETHAN looks at KRIEGER.
Twenty-four hours.  ETHAN looks back at LUTHER.  LUTHER thinks.
And I get to keep the equipment when  we're done.
Luther, I guess you're all out of  excuses.
I can't just hack my way inside.  There's  no modem access to the mainframe, it's in  a stand-alone.  I'd have to be physically  at the terminal.
Luther, relax, it's worse than you think.  The terminal's in black vault lock-down.

While ETHAN talks, we see what he's referring to:  A CIA ANALYST carrying a glass of iced tea and several fi folders walks down a long corridor in the headquarters  building.  He comes to an impressive guard station and re his chin on a strange-looking optometric device.
They missed nothing in that room.  Even  the vents have laser nets over them.   Apparently the device approves and the ANALYST is buzzed a "RESTRICTED" area of the building.
The ANALYST reaches a curtained area. He shoves the curta aside and comes to a large, vaulted door.  He slides a ca key into a slot, leaves it there and slides a second card into the slot beneath it.

Inside, there are three countermeasure  systems that can only be deactivated by  authorized entry.  Which we won't have.  A panel next to the ANALYST says "INTRUSION COUNTERMEASUR OFF."  The ANALYST next spins a three digit combination c CHUNKS the door open and steps into --
-- the secured terminal room.  It's not large but it's  impressive.  A single terminal is bolted into the middle the floor and the glass and tile walls of the room overlo computer storage towers.

The first system is sound-sensitive,  anything above a whisper sets it off.  The second system is on the floor and  pressure-sensitive -- The ANALYST closes the vault door behind him and walks ac the room.  As he walks, the floor tiles light up under hi feet, turning off again when he lifts the weight from the

--and the third detects any increase in  temperature.  Even the body heat of an  unauthorized person in the room will  trigger it.  A thermometer on the wall shows the temperature is 72  degrees.  The ANALYST sets his glass down, boots up the  computer, and starts entering data from the file folders.
All three systems are state of the art.  The ANALYST turns and takes a sip of his iced tea.  A dro condensation runs down the glass and hits the floor. When makes contact, the floor panel lights up.
The other team members gathered around the table look at  ETHAN skeptically.
And you really think we can do this.

The middle of the night and the train is dark. The team  members come out of the stateroom to go to bed -- KRIEGER heads in one direction, ETHAN and CLAIRE in the other. ETHAN stops.  His attention is drawn to the car ahead. Th is a window in the door to the car and he looks through i

Ethan sees the business car, a plush space for busy  executives to get some work done on the train. There are  laptops, cellular phones, desks that fold out in front of spacious seats.  A FEMALE EXECUTIVE, forty or so, is seated at one of the  desks, typing away into her laptop.
ETHAN knocks on the compartment door.
May I come in?
(wary but interested)
Sure...  INT. TRAIN - CLAIREiS COMPARTMENT - NIGHT ETHAN and CLAIRE enter, ETHAN closing the compartment doo He pulls an envelope from his jacket and holds it out to She takes it, waits.
It's cash. And a second passport. If  anything goes wrong when we're inside, if  you sense even the slightest deviation  don't look over your shoulder, you walk  away - you hear me? Just walk away.
You don't think we're going to make it.
I didn't say that.
You didn't have to.........
I just need you to be safe.
What about you?
What about me - Jim called an abort - I  didn't comply.  I lost the team. I just  need you to be safe.  CLAIRE's coolness causes ETHAN to hesitate just enough to take it in.
I wish I'd never laid eyes on you..  And they're suddenly, violently in each others arms, kiss and half-falling onto the converted bed.  She suddenly  resists.  He senses it and pulls away.
Sorry.  He rises and goes to the door.  He's got his hand on the when CLAIRE wraps her arms around him from behind, turns to her and kisses him, deeply.  This time they sink slowl the bed.
Seen from the air, CIA headquarters is a sprawling comple two huge buildings surrounded by acres of parking lots ha out of a thick forest.

KITTRIDGE, BARNES, and their STAFF are hard at work,  photographs and biographical data of ETHAN on various  computer and television screens around the room.  KITTRID leans back in his chair, staring at the ceiling.
What I want to know is how Hunt accessed  the disavowed file, even after we cut off  his authorization code.
He may have used Phelps' code. They were  friends, and Phelps, was still valid for  twenty-four hours.
If that's the case, we need to implement  a system to immediately deactivate an  agent's code immediately...  KITTRIDGE brings his chair legs down on the floor with a

I can't believe what I'm listening to.  Hunt just kicked us in the ass,  you guys  are standing here trying to figure out  what kind of shoes he had on!   I don't care how he did it, I want to know  why he  did it!  Is he recruiting?  For what  purpose?  From somewhere in the building, an ALARM sounds, not too in here.
Survival.  The alarm get louder as it goes off in another part of th building.

Too short sighted.  This guy's proactive, he  initiates .  The question is  what does  he want now and  where does he need to get  it and Barnes what the  hell is that noise?!  An AGENT is just coming in from the hallway.
Fire alarm, Gene.
Oh, for -- do we have to evacuate?
That's S.O.P..
SIRENS BLARING, three fire trucks race past an inconspicu gray van parked on the shoulder of a two lane highway.

Three FIREMEN stomp into the main lobby of the CIA  headquarters building.  ETHAN and KRIEGER are among them, firemen's jumpsuits, carrying packs of equipment.   ETHAN takes a breath as they cross to the GUARD's desk. looks up, above him.  Etched into the top of one wall are the words "AND YE SHA

head_text.subj: KNOW THE TRUTH AND THE TRUTH SHALL MAKE YOU FREE."

text: They reach the GUARD.  ETHAN, who wears Visco glasses, el to the front of the group and takes charge.
(to the Guard)
We picked up alarms in sectors three,  seven, and twelve.  The GUARD checks a screen in front of him.
Yeah.  That's what I've got too.  The FIREMEN look at each other.  Who is this guy?  But he seems to know what he's talking about, so --
(to the Guard)
What sector's the air conditioning?
Uh -- twenty-one, but there's no alarm in  sector twenty-one.
I gotta go in there and shut it down!
Nobody goes into any sector where the  alarm didn't go off.
Do you  want to blow the fire through the  whole building?
(reciting policy)
Nobody goes into  any sector where the  alarm did not go off --
One fire truck is parked slightly behind the others in th parking area of the headquarters building.  Second truck  roars past.  LUTHER watches it go.

LUTHER is in the belly of the fire truck with a ton of  equipment -- three laptops, a bundle of phone cable, a mi dish antenna, a cellular phone, several thick phone compa manuals with names like "COSMOS" and "SWITCHED ACCESS
One laptop serves as a Visco monitor, showing a video ima in which LUTHER watches ETHAN'S point of view of the stub GUARD, who's finishing his sentence.
(on screen)
--and it did  not go off in twenty-one!  LUTHER turns to a screen on another computer and searches through a complex facilities menu.
(mouths)
Twenty-one, twenty-one -- He finds what he's looking for and double clicks on it. red box on his screen lights up --
-- and the same red box lights up on the GUARD'S screen.  From in the distance, a new ALARM begins to wail.
Wait!  Hold it - it's on. Let's go.
Let's move!  ETHAN turns and looks at one of the FIREMEN behind them - it's CLAIRE.  CLAIRE and KRIEGER follow ETHAN/GUARD to  corridor.

CLAIRE quickly slips out of her fireman's jumpsuit, revea a business suit underneath.  She clips an ID tag to her  breast pocket.   She pulls a piece of paper from her pocket, a computer  printout of a man's ID photo.  She stares at the face,  studying it.

CLAIRE, carrying a cup of coffee and a muffin, looks for spot among the tables in the cafeteria of the headquarter building.  She sees a MAN sitting alone, reading a newspaper.  It's man whose picture she looked at in the storage room.  She sits next to him.  He looks up and gives her an acknowledging half smile, th goes back to his paper.  He turns to pick up the paper and in the moment he is fac the other way, CLAIRE pulls out a small vial resembling a perfume sampler.  She dumps the clear liquid contents int his coffee.  He turns back and hands her part of the pape CLAIRE smiles.  COFFEE MAN drinks up.  CLAIRE stares at his shoulder  strangely.  He notices.  She reaches out and flicks something off his shoulder bla He smiles.  But she hasn't flicked something  off his shoulder  blade, she's flicked something  onto it -- a little piece of  shiny gray metallic tape.  CLAIRE leaves the table. COFFE MAN drinks up and leaves the table.
LUTHER stares at another one of his laptops, this one wit blueprint of the inside of the building.  A cursor begins flash in one of the rooms.  LUTHER smiles.
Hi there.
A GUARD carrying an MP5, a handheld machine gun, leads ET and KRIEGER to a heavy metal door marked SERVICE.
Air conditioning's through here!  They turn a corner, walking directly past --  -- COFFEE MAN, who's coming the other way.  We stay with
COFFEE MAN comes out of the cafeteria, walks down the  corridor. he goes to the restricted access door, taps the control panel.

William Donloe.  COFFEE MAN (ANALYST) walks past a GUARD desk and peers in an optometric scanner and we suddenly remember where we'v seen COFFEE MAN before.  He's the TECHNICIAN who works at secured computer terminal.
ETHAN and KRIEGER in the service area - preparing.  ETHAN putting the mask in a bag.  The GUARD returns.

Where's the other guy?  The GUARD moves towards ETHAN, who kicks back at him, pus him back to KRIEGER, who zaps the GUARD on the back of th neck.  He twitches and slumps to the ground, unconscious. KRIEGER quickly grabs him around the neck.  ETHAN turns.  Holding the GUARD'S head with one hand, KRI pulls a stiletto from the sheath in the back of his belt the other.  He jabs it toward the base of the GUARD'S sku -- but ETHAN is on him in a flash.  He grabs KRIEGER's kn arm shoving it up against the wall.  Staring into KRIEGER face in warning.
Zero body count.
(a threat)
We'll see.
Time up.  ETHAN releases him and walks away.

The Guard is tied up, lying on the floor of the Service A Room.  ETHAN and KRIEGER are below the open vent into the duct system.  The first climb is straight up.  KRIEGER cups his hands u ETHAN'S foot and lifts him up into the duct as he starts climb.
ETHAN and KRIEGER crawl quickly through the ducts, moving horizontally now.  They reach a juncture and turn right.
1 - 2 - 3 - Toast, toast.  Luther, I'm  going in.  Don't disappoint me...Krieger,  from here on in, absolute silence.

ETHAN and KRIEGER reach a ventilator shaft in the duct. laser net protects the ventilator, red shafts of light cr crossing every which way.  ETHAN looks down, through the He can see the computer room below and the top of the  TECHNICIAN'S head.

In the duct, ETHAN signals to KRIEGER, making a triangle his hands.  KRIEGER wriggles forward and hands him a mult sided, pyramid shaped glass object.   ETHAN raises the pyramid and intercepts a portion of one the laser net's beams. The pyramid glows and we realise w it is -- a prism.  The laser beam now captive in the prism, ETHAN carefully  moves it out of the centre of the ventilator shaft and  directs it toward another prism, clearing a path through shaft.

Up in the ceiling above it, one of the screws starts to m in the ventilator shaft, unscrewing.  When it appears rea to drop out, a thin strip of metal snakes out from betwee the bars of the shaft and edges up next to the screw.  The screw drops out of its hole but it doesn't drop to th floor, it zips over and clings to the side of the metal s with a gentle CLICK, as to a magnet.  The screw is pulled up, through the shaft.  Now the whole shaft moves, down, into the room, held by a hand.  It turns sideways and is pulled up, into the duct.  A rubber tube snakes down, through the hole, coming to a near the thermostat, which says it's seventy-two degrees. gentle WHOOSH is audible as frosty air blows through the  tube, cooling the room.
The TECHNICIAN defaults the security systems outside the  terminal room.

It is eerily still in the locked-down computer room we sa earlier.  No-one is there, there's not a sound but for th gentle HUM of the computer as it waits to be put to use.  Now  ETHAN's head descends slowly into the room, his hair  falling in front of him.  At first it seems he's just poking his head in for a look but he keeps coming and coming -- first his head, then  shoulders, then waist, then knees, and finally we see his ankles and understand.   He is lowered to stop in front of the thermometer and  temperature read out on the computer.  Suddenly ETHAN is  lifted back up quickly to hang at ceiling height above th computer as the ANALYST enters the room.
The TECHNICIAN crosses to the computer and sits down, a s of work to his right.
The TECHNICIAN is working away at the computer.  He pause and wipes some sweat from his forehead.
With a strange look on his face, the TECHNICIAN looks up. It's almost as if he senses ETHAN above him but instead -
Oh, God.  -- he vomits.   He reaches for the garbage can and upchucks again.  Puzzl sick and feeling another wave coming on, he drags himself his feet, hauls himself across the room and leaves.
Even sick, the TECHNICIAN still thinks to re-activate the alarm systems with a card-key.  They HUM back to life  efficiently, a light flashing:

ETHAN descends again, slowly but steadily, until he is at same height as the computer terminal to hang horizontally front of the computer.  A heavy velcro strap binds his ankles together, secured b rope that leads up into the ventilator shaft and through set of pulleys.
KRIEGER holds the rope, his jaw clenched, sweat breaking on his forehead.
Unfortunately, he's three feet away from it.  He stretche his arms but can't reach.  He blinks, unable to believe this.  He curls himself into situp and looks up, into the shaft.
KRIEGER sees the predicament.

ETHAN gestures to him, pointing to the floor.  Slowly,  KRIEGER drops him another few feet.  Now ETHAN's lower th the terminal and still three feet away from it.  He closes his eyes, summoning his strength and does anoth situp, bringing himself up right in front of the terminal

In the fire truck, LUTHER, who is watching on the Visco  monitor, turns his head upside down to get a look at what ETHAN sees.  He cups his hands around the microphone of his headset an begins to whisper.  We hear only the moist, airy sound of breath, not the words.
Type this password: AW96B6.  Return.  Go  to the files menu, find the NOC list  file.  Open "NOC List."  Put your  diskette in.  Double click on the NOC  list.

ETHAN's ear receiver WHISPERS ever-so-slightly.  He reach out, to the upside down keyboard, cranes his head to see and starts typing, softly.  The computer HUMS, activated.  ETHAN unbuttons his pocket withdraws a 3.5 disk and slides it gently into the floppy drive.  The computer accepts it with a soft WHIR.  ETHAN winces, that soft sound is deafening in these circumstances.   But no alarms go off.
LUTHER cranes his head again to see the computer terminal through ETHAN's trembling viewpoint.  He WHISPERS more  commands.
Ok, good!  It's scrolling.  0K, now we're  going to download.  Edit menu.  Select  "copy to disc".  You're downloading.  When it's all green it's done.
ETHAN types in the contends, presses enter and the screen displays a comforting message:
LUTHER'S eyes widen as he gets his first look, on the Vis monitor, of the specific information they're downloading. The NOC list.
Holy mother of God.

KRIEGER shakes with the strain of holding the rope.  His suddenly widen as he sees something next to him.  It's a rat.  KRIEGER stares. The rat stares back.  Neithe moves.  Puzzled by KRIEGER'S lack of response, the rat cr forward, inquisitive.  KRIEGER's eyes water, his nose twitches.  He's about to  sneeze.
LUTHER pulls himself together and WHISPERS another comman into the microphone.
You've done it.  Eject it.

The 3.5 disk is ejected from the floppy drive.  ETHAN poc it and signals to be raised.  Slowly, his body starts to move up.  As it does, a bead o sweat rolls down his nose, balling at the tip.  ETHAN ignores it.  But below him, he sees the floor tiles four of them lit up under the wheels of the chair at the  computer terminal.   His eyes widen as he realizes something --  --the drop of sweat falls --  --and he  catches it with his right hand.

CIA ANALYST crosses corridor from restricted access door bathroom.  A toilet FLUSHES, smashing the silence, and the TECHNICIA staggers out of the bathroom. He goes to the sink and thr some water on his face. He's still unaware of the piece o shiny metallic tape stuck to his shoulder blade.  He walks out of the bathroom, crosses corridor to door.
On one of LUTHER'S laptops, the blinking cursor starts to move down a corridor.  LUTHER speaks into his microphone.
He's rolling.  Get moving!
ETHAN is near the ceiling, but KRIEGER isn't pulling any  more.  ETHAN looks up at him, wide-eyed and gestures to p him up.  KRIEGER shakes his head no.  ETHAN gestures -- "WHAT?!"
The cursor is halfway across the screen.
Get out of there -- get out of there --
ETHAN still dangles.  Holding the rope with one hand, KRI holds out his other, demanding something.  He wants the d
The TECHNICIAN makes his way back down the corridor, towa the computer room.
The blinking cursor is near the edge of the screen and LU is sweating.
He's at the vault - get moving!  1  yellow, 2 yellows...Toast!
ETHAN, still hanging upside down, has refused.  KRIEGER  demands again.
The TECHNICIAN passes through the optometric scanner.
You're not  moving
ETHAN is hoisted up.
Phew! (to himself) NOC list.
ETHAN has the diskette in his mouth.  KRIEGER leans down takes it.  He drops the knife.
Merci.
We're not outta here yet.

The TECHNICIAN deactivates the alarm systems, swings the  door open and comes back into the room.   He turns to close the door behind him and in so doing jus misses seeing ETHAN'S head as it is pulled back up into t ceiling.
ETHAN throws smoke cannisters and he and KRIEGER crawl  frantically back through the duct, the way they came.
CLAIRE walks quickly past the GUARDS in the reception are and out of the building.

The TECHNICIAN enters the room and shuts the door.  He se the knife, picks it up, looks at it and then puts it down He resumes his work at the computer but when he punches u his program, something prints out on his screen.  Its hea
And it goes on.  The TECHNICIAN'S eyes widen in disbelief He spins back in his chair and reaches for the nearest  telephone.
In the communications room, tempers are running a little  high.  KITTRIDGE is on his feet, berating his staff.
Think , for Christ's sake, you guys are  mired in detail, open your minds, it's  gotta be staring us in the face!  What  does Ethan Hunt  want
Same thing he wanted in Prague!  Same  thing he's always wanted!  The NOC list!
Okay!  Now it's coming together in KITTRIDGE'S mind and a horrib thought occurs to him.
And where is the list vulnerable?  There is nervous silence for a moment.  Behind KITTRIDGE, the other side of the room,  the phone starts to ring
An AGENT gets up to answer it as a creeping fear pervades room.
(joking)

Other than here.  Nervous laughter goes around the table.  It fades.  On th other side of the room, the AGENT who answered the phone  turns, receiver in hand, face ashen.  He holds the phone out to KITTRIDGE, terrified, the beare extremely bad news.  They all turn slowly and look at him.  He holds the phone to KITTRIDGE, shaking slightly.
It's for you.
Kittridge, yup?
It may be a HUMAN SCREAM or it may be a SIREN'S WAIL but echoes over the forest as a lone fire truck ROARS away fr the headquarters building, making its escape.

LUTHER, KRIEGER, CLAIRE and ETHAN, the victorious team, a in the truck's cab.  They exchange looks of massive relie But no one speaks.  LUTHER, in particular, looks heavily  troubled by what they've just done.  ETHAN looks at CLAIRE, who is jammed into the seat next t him.  She drops her head on his shoulder, exhausted.  KRIEGER, in the driver's seat literally and figuratively. ETHAN just looks straight ahead and to CLAIRE.

The TECHNICIAN who discovered the theft of the list sits one end of the now-empty conference table in the  communications room.  KITTRIDGE sits in a chair beside,  staring gravely at him.  He gets up and walks to the door, where HARRY BARNES hove KITTRIDGE lowers his voice, it's barely audible.
(to Barnes)
You and I know about this -- and that's  where it stops.  Understand?  It never happened.
What about him...?  He gestures to the TECHNICIAN, who watches them anxiously
I want him manning a radar tower in  Alaska by the end of the day.  Just mail  him his clothes.  He leaves.  Barnes turns to the TECHNICIAN, who looks up him anxiously.
Night. This street is a row of nondescript hotels, one af the other, with anonymous names like "Hotel Pomeroy," "Ho Vincent," and "Hotel Berridge."

This barely furnished flat is as nondescript as the row o buildings it's in.  ETHAN hurriedly digs through an overn bag until he finds what he's looking for -- the now-batte bible he's used to contact Max.  He flips through the pag and crosses the room to his laptop, which is powered up a waiting on the tiny desk.  LUTHER, alone in a chair across the room. is seriously  preoccupied.  KRIEGER is sprawled-on a ratty sofa, hoisti lager and watching CNN.  CLAIRE is at the window staring out, anxious.  KRIEGER glances over the back of the sofa at ETHAN.
You contacting your buyer?  (no answer)
Ethan?  From the desk, ETHAN glances up.  Then goes back to the  computer.  KRIEGER continues to glare over the sofa back.

Ethan?  Oh, 'scuse me Mr. Hunt?  ETHAN ignores him, working.  His computer jams with stati it connects to a BBS.  The screen blinks and displays the familiar Bible group service through which he's contacted Max.  When it asks him which chapter and verse for the  posting, ETHAN flicks through the Bible, looking for the code.  He  begins to type.  MAX -- Now might be an excellent time  to interpret Scripture face to face.  Meet on TGV, noon tomorrow.  Take  seat 27.  Bring our mutual friend  Job. KRIEGER suddenly appears over his shoulder and knocks bib out of Ethan's hands to the floor.
You're not going to any meeting without me.

My contact is extremely shy.  He goes back to the computer, his finger hovering over th "ENTER" button.  LUTHER and CLAIRE watch this growing conflict closely. ET sighs and stands up.  KRIEGER pulls out the blue disk he from ETHAN in the computer room and waves it in front of
I don't think you're in any position to  give orders, do you?  Not while I'm  holding this.
Krieger.
Stay out of this.
Lachez - moi
T'agueue
Don't you mean this?  He reaches into his briefcase and pulls out an identical  disk.  He puts it back in his jacket pocket.  KRIEGER stares for a second.
That's not it.  That's not the list.
What's the matter, you don't know this  trick?  He holds the jacket pocket wide open, for KRIEGER to look into.  KRIEGER does.  The pocket is empty.
(mock surprise)
Where did it go?!  It's GONE!  ETHAN walks over to CLAIRE, reaches into the pocket of th trousers she's wearing and pulls out the disk.
But not  too far!  He palms the disk in his right hand.

I know what you're thinking, Krieger.  You're thinking, back in the computer  room -- I was up here -- he was down  there -- .  He was carrying two discs.  While he talks, he rotates his hand, palm away from KRIEG When he rotates it back, the disk is gone again.  He hold his left hand.  It's there now.
So hard to keep track of these things.  ETHAN shows his hands -- now  both are empty.
(fuming)
Where is it?  ETHAN pats his pockets, pretending to be frantic.

I thought you had it!  Do you actually  think I'd let you have the NOC list?  KRIEGER just stares at him, shaken.  CLAIRE laughs.  KRIE looks at her.  He turns completely red.  When he looks ba at ETHAN, ETHAN holds  two disks -- one in each hand.

Try any sleight-of-hand with my money and  Iill cut your throat.  He tosses his worthless disk into the trash can and storm out, SLAMMING the door behind him.  ETHAN picks up the Bi and sees Drake Hotel.
I'm so sorry.  Krieger was my call.  I've  never worked with him.  I'm sorry, Ethan.
We did what we had to do.
I'm going to try and get some sleep.  She leaves, closing the door behind her, leaving ETHAN an LUTHER alone.
ETHAN waits a moment, then casually walks to the trash ca picks up the disk KRIEGER threw out and brushes it off  carefully.  He replaces it, in the trash, with the blue disk from his jacket pocket.
Krieger  did have the NOC list.
Now I want you to hold onto it.
What makes you trust me?
Because if you knew what you were getting  into, you never would have done it.
I'm not letting this list get out in the  open.
Exactly, that's your job.  Tomorrow on  the train, you can't let this list get  out into the open.  What's the range of  this thing?
It's hard to tell.  I'm gonna have to be  close.
I'll get you close.  Claire opens the door.
Ethan I need to talk to you.  ETHAN follows CLAIRE into her room where she shows him th television screen.
On the screen, an anchor in the CNN news center.

The unlikely setting...a farm in the  heartland of America...the State of  Wisconsin, where federal agents claim to  have broken the brain trust behind an  international drug ring.
