For a report we  go live now to CNN correspondent (Joe  Jones) in the state capitol, Madison.  (Joe)...?  CNN reporter speaks to camera, on the steps of a courthou
Authorities have identified the couple as  Margaret Ethan Hunt and Donald Hunt.
ETHAN looks.  CLAIRE behind him.
An OLDER COUPLE, mid-sixties, exit the doors and are led the steps of the courthouse in shackles.  The Reporter an other news crews race up to the door.
Here they are now.  Camera follows the couple downstairs.  Police roughly pul them away from the news crews.
They were apprehended this morning by the  DEA in a major sting operation for the  illegal manufacture of the drug  methcathinone, known on the street as  "cat".

Similar to methamphetamines, cat is seen  by officials as one of the most powerful  and dangerous drugs in the world.  Some  thirty-four cat labs have been seized so  far, but the recently widowed Mrs. Hunt  and her brother-in-law are believed to be  involved in a global drug distribution  network.  A public official exits the building.  The reporter and o news crews charge up to him.
Mr. Fairchild, agent Fairchild, a comment  please.  The image on the television changes to an interview with PUBLIC OFFICIAL who faces a bank of microphones.

I think it's sad, really.  Farmers,  unless they're a conglomerate, are always  operating on a paper-thin margin.  I'm  afraid what we have here is a case of a  naive and lonely widow with a lot of  financial problems who chose to make  money through illegal means.

That was John Fairchild, the DEA agent in  charge of this investigation.  Officials  tell me that international law  enforcement agents are expected to arrive  here later today to question the Hunts.  This is Joe Jones, CNN, Love in Madison,  Wisconsin.
Kittridge...

Bastard!  ETHAN switches TV off and paces away from it.  His anger  erupts and he kicks the old filing cabinets, then picks u chair and throws it across the room so it smashes into th wall.  CLAIRE tries to get hold of him, but he shakes her away.
Don't...don't touch me...  CAMERA SWING PANS between them.
What are you going to do?
(turns to her and gestures at TV)
He's expecting my call.  (strides to door)
I'm going to the station...  (o/s at door)
And I'm going to call him.
ETHAN comes out from a side street by Liverpool Street  Underground Station and crosses the road to the main stat CLAIRE watches him from the window.
ETHAN hurries down escalator.  CAMERA MOVES IN on him.  H crosses to the TELEPHONE BOXES. He starts to dial a numbe
A light flashes and a phone BUZZES.  KITTRIDGE in shirt a tie, picks up.  BARNES and several other AGENTS are  monitoring newscasts and engaged in various activities  related to the Hunt case.
(picking up)
Kittridge.
I see you've been out visiting the folks.
(covers receiver)
It's Hunt.  What do you need for a  pinpoint?  (to Ethan)
Been watching a little T.V., have you?  One of the technicians frantically scratches something on piece of foolscap and waves it at KITTRIDGE:  "80 SECONDS KITTRIDGE nods.
Hauling Mom off to jail in shackles was  an especially nice touch.
At the console, the number 44 flashes on the TECHNICIAN'S screen.
He's in England.  BARNES scratches England and 22 seconds on foolscap and w it.
(covering receiver)
Get MI5.  The TECHNICIAN opens another line on his console and begi patching through to Whitehall.

Ethan, I want to reassure you that my  first order of business after you come in  is to get these ridiculous charges  against your family dropped and  eliminated completely from their files.  Come in now, we can plea down the charges  against you as well.  The wall clock is thirty seconds and counting down.  The  TECHNICIAN is frantically signalling KITTRIDGE to keep  talking.  KITTRIDGE is momentarily stuck.  Fortunately:
Can I ask you something, Kittridge?
Certainly Ethan.

If you're dealing with someone who's  crushed, stabbed, shot and detonated five  members of his own IMF team, how  devastated do you think you're going to  make him by marching Ma and Uncle Donald  down to the county courthouse?
I don't know, Ethan. Suppose you tell me?  Click.  ETHAN has hung up.  KITTRIDGE looks hopefully to TECHNICIAN who says:
Lost him.  We needed three more seconds.  Surprisingly KITTRIDGE is not as upset as he is puzzled.
He wanted us to know he was in London.  Clearly that's the question that KITTRIDGE is turning ove his mind and he doesn't have a simple answer to it.

Close Digital clock.  It reads 23.59.  Angle widens to sh ETHAN looking at it with grim satisfaction.  He opens the door of the phone booth and almost SMACKS right into --  --the pale, weary, ghostlike figure of a man standing jus inches in front of him.  Startled, ETHAN looks up, but wh he sees shakes him to the core.  The man is JIM PHELPS
ETHAN SHOUTS and almost falls back into the phone booth.  PHELPS leans against the door of the booth and smiles wea
You're a hard man to catch up with.  PHELPS falls towards ETHAN.  ETHAN tries to speak, but ca even form words.

ETHAN and PHELPS opposite one another in a booth, PHELPS  looking clammy and listing to one side.  But the banter  seems friendly and very quick - two friends and close  colleagues able to follow one another's reasoning easily, finishing each other's sentences:
..the next day I managed to drag myself  to the safe house, must've just missed  you..anyway, I checked our aliases.
- and picked us up in the States -
- but you left before I could get there  and I could check just so many places..
Yeah, smaller countries don't computerize  customs records -
- so I watched Europe. Once you showed  up in England..it was easy.
You knew I liked the rentals at Liverpool  Street.
Hey, I showed 'em to you!
I remember..  PHELPS smiles warmly, has to steady himself to maintain a upright position.  He opens a medicine bottle and takes t pain killers.
Jim, who do you think you're kidding?  A  doctor's gotta look at that.  You can't  sit up straight.
I can sit up straight.  I just can't..sit  up straight very well.  It's not  important!  I saw who shot me.  Ethan, I  saw the mole.  It was Kittridge.  (a fist into the table)
Kittridge! PHELPS grips the sides of the table.
Kitteridge.  Oh my god!  Kittridge is the  mole?
Yeah.
How did Kittridge do it?..
A reprise of PHELPS'S narrative only now ETHAN'S telling and camera is showing the events as ETHAN sees they actua happened.
- first he took care of Jack in the  elevator -  At the Embassy PHELPS sends the elevator to the top of th building, watching it go and crush Kiefer.
- he shot you on the bridge -  On the Charles bridge PHELPS using the Visco glasses aims gun toward them, fires, cants the glasses and tosses them into the Vltava River.
- he must have had back up take out  Golitsyn and Sarah at the fence..  There on the embankment, in the night and fog, it is KRIE who takes out GOLITSYN and SARAH thru the fence..
How did he do Hannah?  Here it is CLAIRE with back to camera who presses the  detonator and turns dreamily to face it, the explosion  brilliant behind her...
No.  No.  He could've taken out Hannah  himself.  PHELPS presses the remote detonator and the car blows..
ETHAN looking intently at him.
Why, Jim?   Why? Awkward moment.

..when you think about it, Ethan, it was inevitable..no more Cold War.  No more secrets you keep from everyone but yourself, operations you answer to no one but yourself.  Then one morning you wake up and find out the President of the United States is running the country - without your permission .  The son-of-a- bitch!  How  dare he?  You realize itis over, youire an obsolete piece of hardware not worth upgrading, youive got a lousy marriage and sixty-two grand a  year.  Kittridge, weill go after that no good son-of-a-bitch, big time!
We donit have to, Jim.  Heill come after us.
Whatis going to make him do that?
What he didnit get in Prague.  The NOC list.
Jesus, Ethan.  Good for you.
A meeting tomorrow on the TGV, enroute to Paris.
Tight security.  No guns.  Real plus.

If I supposedly deliver the NOC list to Max, Max has agreed to deliver Job to me. Iill have Claire and Luther Stickell with me on the train.  Marcel Krieger will have helicopter transport waiting in Paris. PHELPS looks away.  Seems badly shaken.
Jim...?

I was sitting in a cafe waiting for you and suddenly there she was, standing in the rain just outside the safe house..alive and beautiful..and thinking Iim dead and gone.  God knows what sheis had to do forget about me to keep going and get the job done, I.. PHELPS breaks off abruptly.  Apparently some inner strugg over this threatens to overwhelm him.  Then, controlling
- no.  She canit know about me.  No one can.  Not til this is over.  Thereis too much at stake, Ethan.
Youire probably right.
I usually am.
Once we leave the safehouse, get in there and crash.  Iill call you from Paris.
You got it.
And get a doctor.

Good luck. INT. LONDON SAFE HOUSE - CLAIREiS ROOM - NIGHT The door to CLAIRE'S room in the safe house opens, throwi shaft of light over her form.  ETHAN creeps in and closes door behind him. It is approximately one a.m. .  CLAIRE is huddled in the corner.  ETHAN enters and stands looking at her.
What happened?
(walks towards her)
I sent the message to Max.  Weire on for tomorrow.
Okay...
(he steps towards her, stops)
Is this the only way?

Yes.......come here....viens pres moi... She draws him down by his hand to kiss her. He kisses her again, more fully.  She wraps an arm around and he holds onto the kiss.  The room appears to revolve around them.

Suddenly itis bright, broad daylight, so bright it hurts eyes. KITTRIDGE and BARNES step off a military helicopter, blin at the sunlight and hurry down the steps. TWO AGENTS immediately flank KITTRIDGE at the bottom and into step alongside, ready to brief him.  One of them hol out a small package with "for Job" written on it. KITTRIDGE looks at him.  He rips it open.  A note inside simply says:
Noon.

KITTRIDGE looks at his watch.  Itis ten to twelve. As he reads the note, something else falls out of the envelope and CLUNKS to the ground. He bends over, picks it up, and looks at it.  Cradled in hand, we canit see what it is.  But to him, itis very interesting. He steps up his pace, headed for the car.
(to the Agent)
How long to the London Terminus?
Twenty, twenty-five minutes.
Youive got ten.   Move
The sleek front power car, looking like the nose of an SS gets its 25,000 volt charge from the overhead catenary. The rear power car gets its jolt. The TGV starts to move, pulling out of the station.

The business car is similar to the one ETHAN saw on the f train they look across Europe.  Itis crowded, maybe THIRT MEN and WOMEN in suits, most of them already immersed in on their laptops or talking on their cellular phones. One such woman is MAX in her seat, number 27.  MATTHIAS a the OTHER MAN, last seen dropping off ETHAN in Prague, si across from her, her laptop is on the table next to her, her briefcase.
How long until we reach the Chunnel?
Twenty minutes.

A MAN puts a cellular phone and a radio/cassette machine the bunk-bed.  We only see his hands as he proceeds to ta the parts of a pistol out of the cassette machine and assemble a wicked-looking pistol from the seemingly innoc electrical parts inside.
MAX is reading the Financial Times.  MATTHIAS is looking of the window.  A cellular phone rings inside MAXis brief in front of MATTHIAS.  MATTHIAS takes the phone out.
Yes... (holds phone out for Max)
Itis him.
(into phone)
This wasnit what we discussed.
(on phone)

My apologies Max.  Couldnit be helped. Thereis a piece of black cloth under your seat.  Tear it away and youill find the disk. MAX reaches down and does as instructed, finding the comp disk as promised.  She hands it to Matthias who strips of the velcro covering and slots it into the drive next to t computer in the briefcase.  He boots it up quickly and tu the briefcase containing the computer toward MAX for her see. One half of the screen, with the heading "CRYPTONYM AND OPERATIONAL SPECS" is already jammed with information.  T blank second half of the screen acquires the title "TRUE NAME," and information starts filling itself in rapidly - names, addresses, identities. As the two sides match up, a legend flashes:
(back into phone)
Ha, dear boy!  I do hope this doesnit prelude a meeting in private.
It doesnit, dear girl.  as long as you tell me where the money is.
The possibility alone is worth ten million.  Baggage car, rack 3.  Silver briefcase.  Combination 314.
What about Job?
I wouldnit worry about him.  Once youive got the money -- heill find you.
LUTHER, three rows behind in another seat, is at work on laptop of his own.  A mobile Nokia phone is beside it - r light flashing.

KITTRIDGE and BARNES move through the second class car. turn around and start working their way back again. At the front, CLAIRE is getting desperate.  A LARGE MAN passes through the door behind her. The LARGE MAN continues back, nearing KITTRIDGE and BARNE who are forced to step into empty seats on the side in or to make room for him to pass.  As they move by him, their vision is momentarily blocked --
and CLAIRE gets up to follow . She follows to the rear of the car and she passes through door and out of the car, after KITTRIDGE and BARNES talk doorway.
Only four more cars.
And if we donit find him - weill search the whole train again.
Whatis Hunt doing on the TGV?
High speed train.  No-one gets on.  No- one gets off.  High security.  Good place for a pass off to Max.
But why tell us?
Heis putting on a show, Barnes.
What kind of show.
I donit know. (looks at his wrist monitor)
It didnit say on the tickets. KITTRIDGE and BARNES go off back through the next coach. CLAIRE follows into the same doorway and stops to speak i her wristwatch to ETHAN:
Ethan...Kittridge is on the train.
Kittridge is Job.  Max delivered.  How far is he from Luther?
Two cars.  Where are you?
You are my eyes.  Stay with him. She moves onto the next coach, going after KITTRIDGE and BARNES.
On her computer screen in the business car, an ominous message flashes.
MAX dials a number on her cellular phone. She is calling
(into phone)
Heis in the baggage car.
(assembling gun in sleeping compartment)

Iill be there. MAX hangs up and hands the phone to MATTHIAS who slots it into the briefcase next to the computer.  He dials a numb on the keyboard and pushes send.  The computer emits a DI TONE.  Her computer flashes a message.
Whatis the problem.
Connection denied.
Try it again.
Itis not working.
Is something wrong with the phone? (Pause as he tries the phone)
Well is something wrong with the batteries?
I always check the batteries.
Run it through from the top.
The MAN assembling the gun CLICKS the last piece, the silencer, into place. INT. CAR (NEXT TO MAXiS CAR) - MOVING - DAY KITTRIDGE and BARNES looking - stop in doorway.
Nothing but civilians, Gene.
This is bullshit - we donit even know what Max looks like.
Maybe we donit have to know what he looks like.  If heis got that list, heis going to want to check it.  We should be looking for laptops.
Good idea.

LUTHER sees them coming.  He smacks the laptop shut and positions his jamming phone on the table to point at Maxi computer.  He gets up, taking his computer with him, head for the rear of the car.  A WAITER sees the phone and goe after LUTHER with it.
Excuse me, Sir, your telephone... OTHER PASSENGERSi phones nearby go haywire.  LUTHER looks MAX.  Exits car.
Her dial tone finally hits the static of a computer connection and the message on her screen changes:
Itis working.
Phew!  Weive got five minutes...
LUTHER shuts himself in the bathroom.  The OTHER MAN foll him, tries the door and waits his moment.  The OTHER MAN bangs against the door.  LUTHER braces himself against th door.
CLAIRE walking through.  She pauses to listen in her earpiece.
Iive got the money.  Meet me in the baggage car. She walks on.

KITTRIDGE and BARNES are looking at the people in the Business Car behind MAX.  CLAIRE passes them by heading f the last executive coach to get to Club and Baggage Car. passes the OTHER MAN at the bathroom door.  He follows he

Get this door open. KITTRIDGE and BARNES have seen CLAIRE go through MAXiS Business Car and past the OTHER MAN at the bathroom door. They follow, but suspect the locked bathroom door and sto there to listen.
CLAIRE moves swiftly through the last car (after MAXiS ca up into the Club Car and opens the door leading to the BAGGAGE CAR.  Goes in.  The door slams shut.
Hello, Luther.  Whereis Hunt?
Mr. Kittridge, the NOC list is being modemed off the train.
Where?
CLAIRE enters a little breathless.  Spotting PHELPiS prof in the darkened car.
Ethanis right behind me.  Listen to me Jim.  Is it such a good idea to kill him? We take the money.  Ethan takes the blame.  No-one else has seen you alive. No-one will believe him.
Of course - Iim sorry to hear you say that Claire.
Ethan?
Yes.  Ethan Hunt, darling.  Remember him? Here PHELPS pulls out his assembled pistol.
You knew about Jim?
Course he did.  Just exactly when he knew is something of a question.  Before or after I showed in London, mind telling me, Ethan?
Before London.  But after you took the Bible out of the Drake Hotel in Chicago.
They stamped it, didnit they?  Those damn Gideons. PHELPiS watch alarm goes off.
Two minutes til Krieger shows.  Thisill have to be quicker than Iid like. Certainly quicker than youid like.
Ethan, if you knew about Jim?..Why..
Why the masquerade?  Why take the risk? Well, Claire, youive asked the question and you are the answer.
I knew about Jim.

But, he didnit know about you.  In all fairness, Ethan, Claire was never convinced her charms would work with you. But I was supremely confident - having tastes the goods.  "Thou shall not covet thy Neighbouris wife", Ethan.  Oh, Ethan is in love with you, Claire, make no mistake about it.  And like all the  worldis lovers, heis tortured by the same, one pathetic question - "does she feel the same way I do?" JIM turns to CLAIRE.
Well Claire do you?  Have you been exploiting his feelings or returning them?
Jim - lets just get the money and get out of here. CLAIRE goes to ETHAN.
The money Ethan. ETHAN hands her the money.
Youive earned it. CLAIRE goes to Jim with the money.
Count it. CLAIRE starts to count.
Tell me something Claire, that night in Prague, was it you or Jim that blew up the car and scattered Hannah all over town?
Keep counting Claire.
It was me.  I did it. CLAIRE hands PHELPS the money.
Satisfied?
All ten million.
Fold it.  Fold it tight.
Arenit you going to thank me Jim.  Ten million is better than six.

Donit flatter yourself - six was for Eastern Europe .  You made a lousy deal - ten for the world?  What is that?  But I needed you for the transfer with Max.  I got a little extra change;  and you got a little extra too. PHELPiS watch alarm goes off.
Sorry Ethan.  Times up.  Say goodbye.
Youire wrong about one thing.  Iim not the only one whois seen you alive. ETHAN throws JIM the Visco glasses.
Good morning, Mr Phelps. PHELPS and CLAIRE are stunned.
You son of a bitch. PHELPS points the gun at ETHAN.
Donit Jim.
Now we donit have to eliminate him?  You like that, donit you Claire?  Donit you?
Yes.
Jim, itis over.

Ethan - Iive always taught you, nothing can be more dangerous than the truth.  It can kill you. PHELPS shoots CLAIRE.  Struggle between PHELPS and ETHAN. The gun is lost.  PHELPS beats ETHAN to the ground.  His watch alarm beeps rapidly.  He turns, goes up the stairs and... ETHAN goes to CLAIRE.
Claire...Hey...
This stuff is so sticky.
Claire.
Itis all right, Ethan..youill bring me back...wonit you...
I always have, Claire..  CLAIRE dies.  ETHAN looks to ladder hatch and climbs ladd
PHELPS climbs up a ladder past an inert engineer slumped the control panel -- an obvious earlier victim of PHELPS. PHELPS puts on a pair of clear goggles, reaches a trap do and climbs through it --

-- halfway out onto the roof of the train.  He reaches in his jacket pocket and pulls out a suction cup with a hand on the end of it.  He SMACKS the suction cup down on the and pulls himself the rest of the way out.  He pulls out a second suction cup and SMACKS it down on t smooth surface of the train.  Now for the tough part.  Using the suction cups, PHELPS  slowly pulls himself forward, a foot at a time, pulling a replanting the cups as he goes.   He drags himself over the length of the final car, to the back of the train, where the rear engine slants off sharp a window for the ENGINEER.  Half kneeling on the roof, PHELPS pulls out the clip from belt. He looks up, scanning the sky behind the train.  From out of the fog, a  helicopter approaches.  PHELPS turns and looks ahead, in the direction the train going.  In the distance, he can see the chunnel approachi the tunnel under the English Channel.  His eyes widen.
KRIEGER is at the controls.  He sees the approaching tunn as well.

PHELPS crawls like hell to get into position.  Looking up sees KRIEGER pointing frantically behind him. PHELPS turn ETHAN is climbing out the trap door.  A cable and hook swing down from the helicopter, almost  touching the roof of the train. PHELPS crawls closer to i ETHAN, behind him, is in a far more precarious position.  Without goggles or suction cups, he has to use his finger grab small holes on the roof.   He is flipped over by the wind, ending up facing the othe way.  Loses his grip and is blown backwards over the roof
KRIEGER sees the Chunnel entrance approaching.  He gestur to PHELPS and tries to move the cable closer to him, pass over PHELPS and then back to him.

PHELPS grabs the cable and is about to hook the cable ont his belt, ETHAN slides into him and they both crash onto roof.  ETHAN grabs the cable out of PHELPS hand and clips it ont the roof.  PHELPS and ETHAN struggle, but they are hurtling dangerou closer to the chunnel entrance.  They're now right on top of the chunnel entrance.
KRIEGER sees the tunnel, only seconds away now.  He paws the controls, jerking back desperately on a certain lever
PHELPS kicks ETHAN and he falls off the far side of the  train.  PHELPS falls off the near side and holding onto t strap manages to pull himself back on.  -- The train ZOOMS into the tunnel --

head_text.subj: -- AND THE HELICOPTER ROARS RIGHT IN BEHIND IT

text: As the train roars into the tunnel, the business car goes nearly dark and the message on MAX'S computer screen chan one last time.  This time it says:
TRANSFER LOST.
MAX'S face falls.
Damn!
Another CONDUCTOR races into the power car, past his iner companion, and is shocked to see the copter right behind train.  He grabs a radio and SCREAMS into it.
No, no, it's
the tunnel!
Stop the train!
It'll crash into us!  Accelerate,  accelerate.
For a moment, we see no one.  No ETHAN.  No PHELPS.  Movi around to the other end of the car, we see where they've  gone.  They're dangling from either side of it

PHELPS paws for one of the suction cups and pulls himself back onto the roof of the train.  ETHAN reaches for the o cup.  The helicopter, fortunate that this tunnel is double trac and barely wide enough to accomodate it, pursues, KRIEGER pushing it up to full speed again.  But it can't lift up high enough to go completely over th train.

PHELPS, nearing the back, manoeuvers himself to the  windshield of the rear power car, trying to grab the skid KRIEGER'S copter.  He doesn't see what's headed toward him, coming from the  other direction.  Another train.  At the last moment, PHELPS notices the reflection of the  oncoming train in the windshield and swings back onto the roof of his train, barely avoiding getting creamed by it it blows by.  The helicopter avoids the oncoming train too -- and PHELP misses the skid.   KRIEGER tips the front of the copter, trying to decapitat ETHAN with the rotor.  PHELPS jumps onto the skid, but th copter pitches so far forward the blade hits the top of t tunnel.  SPARKS and chunks of cement fly.   KRIEGER levels the chopper quickly.  ETHAN uses the momen leap from the train onto the other helicopter skid.  PHELPS and ETHAN now hang on the skids, facing one anothe Crouching on the skid, ETHAN digs in his pocket and pulls out --
a red and green piece of bubble gum
PHELPS sees it and SCREAMS at KRIEGER, who scrambles  frantically for his gun.

Red light, green light.  Asta Lasagna  mother fucker.  ETHAN mashes the red into the green, slaps the gum onto t copter's underbelly and turns away from it.  PHELPS kicks vainly at the gum, SCREAMING --  -- but the gum EXPLODES.  The force of the blast rockets  ETHAN forward, he lands on the train's windshield.  The helicopter whirls and BASHES into the tunnel, veers  wildly, then pitches forward and down, smashing PHELPS un the skid and EXPLODING in a giant fireball.  ETHAN, stuck on the windshield, can only watch as the  wreckage of the copter tumbles down the train towards him It stops just short of him, with its bent and broken roto blade barely missing his throat.   ETHAN lays his head against the windshield glass, utterly drained.
KITTRIDGE comes back into the business car and is joined BARNES.  LUTHER, only slightly bruised, stands up next to them and gestures to MAX and her laptop.

I think this is what you're looking for.  MAX looks up, stunned.  KITTRIDGE leans over and peers at screen. He just smiles and sits down next to her, content wait for her to speak.  When she finally does, she's almost charming.
My lawyers will have a field day with  this.  Entrapment, jurisdictional  conflicts --  KITTRIDGE leans closer to her and lowers his voice, just friendly.
Maybe we'll just keep the courts out of  this one.
I'm sure we can find something I have  that you need.
You know, I would  love to try.

LUTHER sits on a high stool, his PowerBook next to him, w he sips a beer.  A television screen is featuring follow- coverage of yesterday's dramatic helicopter-train wreck i the chunnel.  Aside from emphasizing that it was the work a lone, crazed character in a helicopter who was killed i the crash, there are comments about how miraculous it was there were no other fatalaties.  There are intermittent  sounds of aircraft taking off and landing, announcements arrivals and departures.  ETHAN into shot.  He sits besid
Reach your folks?  (ETHAN nods)
How they feeling?
About what?
The official apology from the Justice  Department, the VIP treatment, you know,  the whole nine yards.
Well my Mother was a little confused  about how the DEA could mistake her and  Uncle Donald for a couple of dope smugglers  in the Florida keys.  LUTHER picks up his beer.
(Laughs and with a British accent)
Cheers.  They drink.
Here's to  you, Luther. (clink glasses)  To  being off the disavowed list.
Hey, I'm the flavour of the month!
You're more than that, Luther.  They were  mistaken about you and they're trying to  show you they know it.  They want you  back in.
Sure.  They want me back in so I won't  break in!  They  still can't figure out  how we did it.
You didn't tell 'em at the debriefing?
I figured I'd let 'em reinstate my back  pay, give me a promotion, check out my  office at Langley and  then , maybe, talk  about it.
(laughing)
It's all one big negotiation, isn't it?
Why don't you come back with me?
Just don't know why I'd be doing it.
You really liked Phelps, didn't you?
He was a good guy for a long, long time.  Just - not long enough. (looks up) Gotta  catch my flight..(rising)  So.  How's it feel being a solid citizen  again?
Oh man...I don't know.  I'm gonna miss  being disreputable.

Well, Luther - if it makes you feel any  better I'll always think of you that way.  The two men understand one another and LUTHER will say no more.  The two exchange slight gestures of farewell and i moment ETHAN disappears from the bar, leaving a contempla LUTHER looking after him.
ETHAN HUNT slumps down in his scat, dosing. A FLIGHT  ATTENDANT makes her way down the aisle, holding a case fi with movie cassettes. She stops before a lady passenger.
Would you like to watch a movie, Miss  Clarke?  She then stops before ETHAN.
Excuse me, Mr. Hunt.  Would you like to watch a movie.
No, thank you.
Would you consider the cinema of the  Caribbean?  ETHAN just stares at her.  This couldn't be what it's  sounding like.
Aruba, perhaps?  The camera moves into ETHAN's face.  They found him.  The want him back.  He looks up at her and.....
